1.verse: This is the ·message [oracle; burden] Habakkuk the prophet received.

2.verse: Habakkuk Complains - LORD, how long must I ·ask [cry; call] for help and you ·ignore [do not hear] me? I cry out to you ·about violence [or “Violence!”], but you do not ·save [rescue] us!

3.verse: Why do you make me see ·wrong things [evil; iniquity; injustice] and make me look at ·trouble [wrongdoing]? ·People are destroying things and hurting others [Destruction and violence are] in front of me; ·they are arguing and fighting [strife and conflict arise].

4.verse: So the ·teachings [law; instruction; Torah] are ·weak [paralyzed], and justice never comes. Evil people ·gain while good people lose [surround/hem in the righteous]; ·the judges no longer make fair decisions [so justice is perverted].

5.verse: The Lord Answers - “Look at the nations! Watch them and be ·amazed and shocked [utterly astounded]. I will do something in your ·lifetime [days] that you won’t believe even when you are told about it.

6.verse: I will ·use [raise up] the ·Babylonians [Chaldeans], those ·cruel [ruthless; bitter] and ·wild [impetuous; hasty] people who march across the earth and ·take lands [seize dwellings] that don’t belong to them.

7.verse: They scare and ·frighten [terrify] people. ·They do what they want to do and are good only to themselves [Their justice/judgment and dignity proceed from themselves].

8.verse: Their horses are faster than leopards and ·quicker [fiercer] than wolves ·at sunset [of the evening]. Their ·horse soldiers [cavalry] attack quickly; they come from places far away. They attack quickly, like an ·eagle [or vulture] ·swooping down for food [swift to devour].

9.verse: They all come ·to fight [for violence]. ·Nothing can stop them [or …a horde moving like an east wind; or …their faces set forward]. Their prisoners are ·as many as the grains of [like] sand.

10.verse: They ·laugh at [mock] kings and make fun of rulers. They laugh at all the ·strong, walled [fortified] cities and build ·dirt piles to the top of the walls [earthen siege ramps] to capture them.

11.verse: Then they ·leave [sweep by] like the wind and move on. They are guilty of ·worshiping their own strength [making their strength their god; or ascribing their strength to their gods].”

12.verse: Habakkuk Complains Again - LORD, ·you live forever [are you not from everlasting…?], my God, my holy God. We will not die. LORD, you ·have chosen the Babylonians to punish people [appointed them for judgment]; our Rock [Ps. 61:2], you picked them to punish.

13.verse: Your eyes are too ·good [pure] to look at evil; you cannot ·stand to see [tolerate; look on] those who do wrong. So how can you put up with those ·evil [treacherous] people? How can you be quiet when the wicked swallow up people who are ·better [more righteous] than they are?

14.verse: You ·treat [or made] people like fish in the sea, like sea animals without a ·leader [ruler].

15.verse: ·The enemy [He] brings them in with hooks. He catches them in his net and ·drags [gathers] them in his ·fishnet [dragnet]. So he rejoices and ·sings for joy [is glad].

16.verse: The enemy offers sacrifices to his net and burns incense to ·worship it [his dragnet], because it lets him live ·like the rich [in luxury] and enjoy ·the best [or plentiful] food.

17.verse: Will he keep on ·taking riches with [emptying] his net? Will he go on destroying ·people [nations] without showing mercy?

1.verse: I will stand like a guard to watch and ·place [station] myself at the tower. I will wait to see what he will say to me; I will wait to learn how ·God will answer [or I will answer concerning] my complaint.

2.verse: The Lord Answers - The LORD answered me: “Write down the vision; write it ·clearly [plainly] on clay tablets so whoever reads it can run to tell others.

3.verse: ·It is not yet time for the message to come true [For the vision awaits an appointed time], ·but that time is coming soon [it hastens to the end; or it speaks about the end]; the message will ·come true [not lie]. ·It may seem like a long time, but [Though it tarries/lingers] be patient and wait for it, because it will surely come; it will not be delayed.

4.verse: [Look; Behold] ·The evil nation [He] is ·very proud of itself [puffed up]; ·it [his soul] is not ·living as it should [upright]. But ·those who are right with God [the righteous] will live ·by faith [or because of their faithfulness; Rom. 1:17; Gal. 3:11; Heb. 10:38].

5.verse: “Just as wine ·can trick [betrays] a person, those who are too proud will not ·last, [have rest; settle down] ·because their desire is like a grave’s desire for death [he opens wide his throat like Sheol; the grave or the underworld], and like death they always want more. They gather other nations for themselves and collect for themselves all the ·countries [peoples].

6.verse: But all ·the nations the Babylonians have hurt [these] will ·laugh at [taunt] them. They will ·make fun of the Babylonians [ridicule with riddles] and say, ‘·How terrible it will be for [Woe to] the one that ·steals many things [piles up what is not his]. How long will that nation get rich by ·forcing others to pay them [extortion; goods taken in pledge]?’

7.verse: “·One day the people from whom you have taken money will [Will not your creditors…?] turn against you. They will ·realize what is happening [wake up] and make you shake with fear. Then ·they will take everything you have [you will become their plunder].

8.verse: Because you have ·stolen from [plundered] many nations, those who are left will ·take much from [plunder] you. ·This is because you have killed many people [For the human blood you have shed], ·destroying [violently attacking] countries and cities and everyone in them.

9.verse: “·How terrible it will be for the nation [Woe to him] that ·becomes rich by doing wrong [builds his house with unjust gain; or acquires evil gain for his own house], thinking they will ·live in a safe place [set his nest on high] and escape ·harm [the hand of evil].

10.verse: Because you have ·made plans [plotted; schemed] to ·destroy [cut off] many people, you have brought shame to your house. Because of it, you will ·lose your lives [forfeit your soul/life].

11.verse: The stones of the walls [of the “house” of Babylon] will cry out against you, and the ·boards that support the roof [beams of the woodwork] will ·agree that you are wrong [echo the complaint; answer back].

12.verse: “·How terrible it will be for the nation [Woe to him] that ·kills people [uses bloodshed] to build a city, that ·wrongs others [uses injustice] to start a town.

13.verse: [Look; Behold] The LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] will send fire to destroy what those people have built; all the nations’ ·work [weariness] will be for nothing.

14.verse: Then, just as water covers the sea, ·people everywhere will know [the earth will be filled with the knowledge of] the LORD’s glory.

15.verse: “·How terrible for the nation that [Woe to him who] makes its neighbors drink, pouring ·from the jug of wine [or out your wrath] until they are drunk so that it can look at their naked bodies.

16.verse: ·You Babylonians [You] will be filled with ·disgrace [shame], not ·respect [glory]. It’s your turn to drink and ·fall to the ground [or expose your uncircumcision] like a drunk person. The ·cup of anger [cup; Jer. 25:15–29] from the LORD’s right hand is coming around to you. You will receive ·disgrace [shame], not ·respect [glory].

17.verse: You ·hurt many people [did violence] in Lebanon, but now you will be ·hurt [overwhelmed by it]. You killed many animals there, and now you must be afraid because of ·what you did [the blood and violence you did] to that land, those cities, and the people who lived in them.

18.verse: The Message About Idols - “·An idol does no good [What value does an idol have…?], because a human made it; it is only a ·statue [metal image] that teaches lies. The one who made it ·expects his own work to help him [trusts in his own creation], but he makes idols that can’t even speak!

19.verse: ·How terrible it will be for [Woe to] the one who says to a wooden statue, ‘·Come to life [Wake up]!’ ·How terrible it will be for [Woe to] the one who says to a silent stone, ‘·Get up [Arise]!’ It cannot ·tell you what to do [teach/guide us]. It is only a statue covered with gold and silver; there is no ·life [breath] in it.

20.verse: The LORD is in his Holy Temple; all the earth should be silent ·in his presence [before him].”

1.verse: Habakkuk’s Prayer - This is the prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, on shigionoth [probably a literary or musical term].

2.verse: LORD, I have heard the ·news [report] about you; I am ·amazed [in awe; afraid] at what you have done. LORD, do great things once again in ·our time [the midst of the years]; make ·those things happen again [them known] in ·our own days [the midst of the years]. Even when you are angry, remember to be ·kind [compassionate].

3.verse: God is coming from Teman [near Edom, south of Israel]; the Holy One comes from Mount Paran [on the Sinai peninsula south of Israel; the language recalls God’s revelation at Mount Sinai; Deut. 33:2]. Selah His glory covers the ·skies [heavens], and his praise fills the earth.

4.verse: He is like ·a bright light [flashing lightning; or brightness at dawn]. Rays of light ·shine [flash] from his hand, and there he hides his power.

5.verse: ·Sickness [Plague] goes before him, and ·disease [pestilence] follows ·behind him [at his feet].

6.verse: He stands and ·shakes [or measures] the earth. He looks, and the nations ·shake [or jump] with fear. The ·mountains, which stood for ages, [eternal mountains] ·break into pieces [crumble]; the ·old [age-old; everlasting] hills ·fall [sink] down. ·God has always done this [Ancient paths/ways are his].

7.verse: I saw that the tents of Cushan [located in southern Transjordan] were in ·trouble [distress] and that the ·tents [curtains] of the land of Midian trembled [Ex. 15:14–16; Josh. 2:9–10].

8.verse: LORD, were you angry at the rivers, or ·were you angry at [was your wrath against] the streams? Were you ·angry [enraged] with the sea when you rode your horses and chariots of victory?

9.verse: You ·uncovered [pulled out; brandished] your bow and commanded many arrows to be brought to you. Selah You split the earth with rivers.

10.verse: The mountains saw you and ·shook with fear [writhed; trembled]. The ·rushing [raging; torrents of] water ·flowed [swept by]. The ·sea [deep] ·made a loud noise [shouted; roared], and ·its waves rose high [lifted its hands high].

11.verse: The sun and moon stood still in ·the sky [lofty dwelling place]; they stopped when they saw the flash of your flying arrows and the ·gleam [glint] of your ·shining [flashing] spear.

12.verse: In ·anger [indignation] you marched on the earth; in anger you ·punished [trampled; threshed] the nations.

13.verse: You came out to ·save [rescue] your people, to save your ·chosen one [anointed]. You crushed the ·leader [head] of the ·wicked ones [house of the wicked] and ·took everything he had [lay him bare], from ·head to toe [foundation to neck]. Selah

14.verse: With the enemy’s own ·spear [or arrows] you ·stabbed the leader of his army [pierced his head; or pierced the heads of his soldiers/warriors]. His ·soldiers [warriors] rushed out like a storm to scatter us. ·They were happy [Rejoicing; Shouting with joy] as they were ·robbing [plundering] the poor people in secret.

15.verse: But you ·marched through [trampled on] the sea with your horses, stirring the great waters.

16.verse: I hear these things, and my body trembles; my lips ·tremble [quiver] when I hear the sound. My bones ·feel weak [rot away], and my legs shake. But I will wait patiently for the day of ·disaster [calamity] that will come to the people who ·attack [invade] us.

17.verse: Fig trees may not ·grow figs [blossom; bud], and there may be no grapes on the vines. ·There may be no olives growing [The produce of the olive fails/disappoints] and no food growing in the fields. There may be no sheep in the ·pens [fold] and no cattle in the ·barns [stalls].

18.verse: But I will still ·be glad [rejoice] in the LORD; I will ·rejoice [be joyful] in God my Savior.

19.verse: The Lord GOD is my strength. He makes ·me like a deer that does not stumble [my feet like a deer’s] so I can walk on the ·steep mountains [heights]. For the director of music. On my stringed instruments.
